The impact of the change in the value of the Euro was partially offset by a $2.1 million increase in restructuring charges, a $0.7 million increase in R&D expenses, and a $0.6 million increase in SG&A expenses. The reduction in the percent change was due primarily to the increase in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.
results.json_rows_response:
In fiscal year 2018, net sales of $3.6 million for segment operating income (loss) and $1.2 million for segment operating income (loss) for the fiscal years 2018 and 2017 were $1.1 million and $1.2 million, respectively. These were the result of the following adjustments:
(1) Adjusted for inflation in fiscal year 2018 through 2017, the increase in net sales for segment operating income (loss) for fiscal year 2018 was $0.2 million. This increase in net sales was primarily attributable to an increase in net sales of $1.1 million in the OEM channel of the EMEA region and a $0.6 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, APAC, and the Asia-Pacific region.
(2) Adjusted for inflation in fiscal year 2017 through 2017, the increase in net sales for segment operating income (loss) for fiscal year 2017 was $0.6 million. This increase was primarily attributable to a $1.4 million increase in SG&A expenses and a $0.6 million increase in R&D expenses.
